src.multimodal.textual package

Submodules

src.multimodal.textual.TextualCnnFeatureExtractor module

class src.multimodal.textual.TextualCnnFeatureExtractor.TextualCnnFeatureExtractor(gpu='-1')[source]

Bases: CnnFeatureExtractorFather

extract_feature(sample_input)[source]

It does extract the feature from the input. Framework, model and layer HAVE TO be already set with their set methods. :param sample_input: the String in input to process :return: a numpy array that will be put in a .npy file calling the right Dataset Class’ method

set_model(model)[source]
Parameters:

model_name – is the name of the model to use as a String. NOTE: in this case we are using transformers so the model name have to be in its list. Since we are using transformers here, it is needed also to point the repo so: ‘repo/model’

Returns: nothing but it initializes the protected model and tokenizer attributes, later used for extraction :param model:

src.multimodal.textual.TextualDataset module

class src.multimodal.textual.TextualDataset.TextualDataset(input_directory_path, output_directory_path)[source]

Bases: DatasetFather

create_output_file(index, extracted_data, model_layer)[source]

Overwrites the method of the Father class because all the Strings come from the same file, and it only changes the row :param index: it indicates the row of the String :param extracted_data: the output to put in the file :param model_layer: the layer used, it is a String, it will be shown on the final name

set_clean_flag(text_to_be_cleaned)[source]

It does set the flag to clean the String before preprocessing, this phase is heavily recommended, therefore the flag by default is set to True :param text_to_be_cleaned: flag True/False if the text will be preprocessed and cleaned

Returns: nothing

set_preprocessing_flag(preprocessing_flag)[source]
set_type_of_extraction(type_of_extraction)[source]

It set the origin of the data, from item or users interactions, it is needed later to read correctly the tsv :param type_of_extraction: ‘items’ or ‘interactions’
